Enterprise AI @ NJIT

Enterprise AI
Program

Building the first Enterprise-focused AI degree in the region at New Jersey Institute of Technology. Classical liberal arts education meets modern AI technology and Fortune 100 professional practices.

What Makes This Different

01 — Philosophy

Classical + Modern Fusion

Advanced technical skills in LLM models and Fortune 100 techniques, combined with ethics, values, and humanistic thinking. History, psychology, and communication integrated with cutting-edge AI development.

02 — Curriculum

Enterprise Focus

Not just theory. Internet history, Cialdini persuasion psychology, archetypal branding, professional design vocabulary, accessibility (WCAG), business tools (Calendly, Zapier), Git/GitHub workflows, and AI-augmented development.

03 — Experience

Service-Learning

Students work with community organizations before graduation. Real-world impact, professional portfolio, and connections to Newark's ecosystem. Fortune 100 recruiting pipeline proven over 23 years.

Sample Course:
Web Presence

15-week comprehensive program integrating psychology, history, business, and professional development

Part 1 — Foundations (Weeks 1-5)

  • → Internet & E-Commerce History
  • → Psychology of Persuasion (Cialdini's 6 Principles)
  • → Professional Design Vocabulary & Critique
  • → Git/GitHub & Linux Fundamentals
  • → Accessibility (WCAG), Performance & Legal Requirements

Part 2 — Individual Project (Weeks 6-10)

  • → Personal Brand Strategy with AI
  • → Portfolio Site Foundation
  • → Persuasion Implementation & Conversion Optimization
  • → Business Tools Integration (Calendly, Zapier)
  • → Testing, Optimization & Launch

Part 3 — Group Project (Weeks 11-15)

  • → Team Formation & Planning (GitHub Workflow)
  • → Collaborative E-Commerce Site Foundation
  • → Conversion Psychology & User Journey
  • → Content Strategy & Legal Compliance
  • → Testing, Launch & Professional Presentation

Research-Informed Approach

My approach is informed by research into past technological transitions. Analysis of the printing press, the industrial revolution, and the internet reveals consistent patterns.

Historical Pattern: (1) Transformative technology emerges that can significantly increase productivity. (2) Early adopters benefit while others lack awareness of opportunities. (3) Stakeholders act independently—educators, businesses, communities, and government operate in silos. (4) Gaps can persist—communities without coordinated support face barriers to participation.

AI exhibits similar patterns at accelerated pace. By applying lessons from history, I'm taking proactive steps to ensure inclusive access to AI education and opportunity. Evidence-based coordination among stakeholders creates the most equitable outcomes.

Technical Research Focus: Advanced ETL pipelines combining LLMs and machine learning for NLP and knowledge graph construction. RAG workflows for personalized knowledge production. AI-augmented QA review systems. Generative AI techniques for training, augmenting, and automating software engineering processes.

Why This Works

"AI will democratize access to specialized knowledge and skills. The age of AI will challenge long-held assumptions about education, work, and expertise."

Success in this era requires not just technical literacy, but communication, collaboration, accountability, and strategic thinking. The Enterprise AI program develops all these capabilities through integrated coursework that mirrors real-world professional environments.

Fortune 100 Practices From Day One

Development Workflow

  • → Git/GitHub Collaboration
  • → Pull Request Reviews
  • → CI/CD Pipelines
  • → Automated Testing

Quality Standards

  • → WCAG AA Accessibility
  • → Lighthouse Performance
  • → Code Quality Gates
  • → Legal Compliance

Business Tools

  • → Calendly Integration
  • → Zapier Automation
  • → Analytics Setup
  • → Payment Processing

Student Outcomes

23-Year Track Record

10,000+ students taught across 15 sections annually. Graduates working at Amazon, Google, JPMorgan, Goldman Sachs, and hundreds of other companies. Many building their own startups in Newark.

Service-Learning Impact

Students work with community organizations, building real solutions while developing professional portfolios. Connections to Newark's ecosystem, Fortune 100 companies, and local startups.

Interested in the Enterprise AI Program?

Whether you're a prospective student, hiring partner, or community organization—there are multiple ways to engage with the program.
